blog.name: acquatempo
blog.description:
“Giuro solennemente di non avere buone intenzioni.”

Harry Potter

Quante volte ho detto a me stessa che avrei buttato tutto via e poi sono andata oltre?Quante volte mi sono guardata allo specchio e mi sono detta: "Da oggi cambio tutto." E poi non è cambiato niente.

Quante volte guardando il mare confondersi con le nuvole a dicembre ho pensato che tutto sommato al mondo c'era ancora qualcosa che mi spingeva ad aspettare l'azzurro?

Vent'anni.

Quando avevamo sei/sette anni, alle elementari immaginavamo che saremmo state tutte amiche inseparabili, che la nostra vita sarebbe andata un po' come quella di Zoey 101, ragazzi, feste, guai e risate.

Poi la vita ci ribalta addosso qualcosa di nuovo, ci versa contro qualcosa di cui non sapevamo nemmeno l'esistenza.

Crescere, ritrovarsi soli, avere pochi amici, studiare ed avere mille pensieri in testa, avere sedici anni e non vedere la fine di un liceo che ci sembra la gabbia più grande della nostra vita. Poi passa anche quello. Passano gli esami di maturità, la sveglia alle 6:30, i ripassi, le verifiche, i bigliettini.

Passa certo, ma a che prezzo?

Ci ritroviamo soli in mezzo ad un mondo che non ha buone intenzioni.

Fare fronte alla vita è come aprire una porta segreta, se lo si fa con le migliori intenzioni ciò che sta al di là ci schiaccerà.

Sono Giada e se sei qui per sentirti dire che tutto passa, che l'amore ti salverà o altre cose simili, beh te l'ho già detto qui.

Perché ripetersi, no?

IG: giada.l

summary:
Oggi a lavoro è successa una cosa tristissima. 
La responsabile, ragazza di toh 27 anni massimo 30, si è arrampicata sugli...
body:
Oggi a lavoro è successa una cosa tristissima.

La responsabile, ragazza di toh 27 anni massimo 30, si è arrampicata sugli scaffali di metallo in magazzino per prendere una maglietta.

Era in alto e al momento di tornare giù fa “oddio aspetta - riferito al vice responsabile nonché suo ragazzo - non so scendere”, dopo poco scende senza troppa difficoltà e una volta a terra le faccio “ecco fatto, come Spider-Man!:)”.

(Specifico che era un momento di assoluta calma, in negozio non c’era un cane, avevamo parlato poco prima) LEI SI GIRA DALL’ALTRA PARTE CON UNA FACCIA DA ‘ma che cazzo ha detto questa’ E CONTINUA CON I SUOI AFFARI SENZA DEGNARMI DI UNO SGUARDO.


E no gente, nse po lavorà in queste condizioni.

CHI non conosce Spider-Man???

CHI non apprezza una battuta su Spider-Man???

Non ci siamo proprio.


(A regà se scherza eh)

((Però ci sono rimasta davvero male lol mi sono sentita come se avessi detto la cazzata più grande della storia quando invece, ripensandoci, era una cosa carina))

MA PERCHÉ LA GENTE È STRANA PT.indefinita di infinite

summary: now that i'm thinking about it...the first MCU film i watched was guardians then black panther and spider-man. they were...
body: now that i’m thinking about it…the first MCU film i watched was guardians then black panther and spider-man. they were honestly the only movies/characters i cared about. i’m not that huge on the avengers even though i do love Thor now.

summary: Text Messages -- a Peter Parker one-shot. Hello, guys. This is my first time publishing anything Marvel related. And my first...
body:
Text Messages – a Peter Parker one-shot.

Hello, guys. This is my first time publishing anything Marvel related. And my first time publishing any fic here :)

If you enjoy it please reblog and like and pass it on for anyone that’s interested. You guys can comment and send me messages please :)

This is a Peter Parker x OC. CAUTION: INFINITY WAR SPOILERS AHEAD. 

Words: 1024

Aileen was worried sick. 

        Peter had just jumped out of the bus, ready to fight whatever had arrived in the strange round ship. He left, leaving an empty space next to her. He left, with only a squeeze in her hand and a reassuring smile. A smile that said everything would be okay and the he would be back. 

        Aileen wasn’t sure about that anymore. 

        He was gone for hours. And she made sure to stay with Aunt May, so they could emotionally support each other. So she could at least have a sense that Peter, her  Peter, was still there with her. That he did not leave an emptiness inside her when he jumped out of the window not saying anything if he was going to be back or not. Aileen was starting to think that maybe he wouldn’t. And that thought brought tears in her eyes. 

        They had started to date a few months before. Peter took his time to ask her out. After the fiasco with Liz, he didn’t want to jump on another fantasy with some girl that he may not even have a future with. He wanted to make sure he was sure about the girl he went out with. Because he didn’t want to get hurt.         

        When Aileen showed up, it was too good to be true. She was perfect, in Peter’s eyes. She was smart, funny and cute. Aileen was everything he had ever wanted in girl. She was friendly with everyone, even if they were mean to her, and she looked at Peter with the most soft brown eyes he had ever seen. Aileen was going to be Peter’s doom. 

        He asked her out a year later. She said yes. Aileen was waiting for that the entire year she was at Midtown Tech. She loved spending time with Peter. And slowly, she fell in love with him. To her, Peter Parker was the dream boy. He was smart, the smartest person she had ever met, funny, he would make this jokes not intentionally and she would laugh until tears would get out of her eyes, and adorable. How did a guy like him existed?

        Aileen found out Peter was Spider Man a few weeks into their friendship. It only made her fall in love with him more. Except, she didn’t know it would be the doom of her. 

        It was only three hours later that Aileen decided to text Peter. She hoped where he was had cell signal. She hoped he was still alive to answer her. 

Aileen: Are you okay? 

        She sighed, gazing at her phone. She hoped he was alive. She hoped she would get to say all the things she didn’t get to say to him. She really wanted him to come back. 


Aileen had no idea what time it was when he responded. 

        She took her phone and immediately unlocked it. He was alive, and he had answered her text. 

Peter: Um, Karen, answer her that I’m alive. That I will go back to her when this is over. Text her that I love her. 

        Aileen read through the text hundred times. He was alive. And Karen, his A.I., clearly needed to learn how to text. But most, importantly, he loved her. She smiled, a couple of tears running on her cheeks. She texted rapidly to him.

Aileen: I love you too. 

          She quickly got up of Peter’s bed. She needed to tell May that he was alive. 


Aileen wasn’t sure how many times she checked her phone waiting for an answer. 

        She had sent a couple of other texts to him. He had answered all of them. But the last one he hadn’t answered yet. 

Aileen: Is it over yet? I miss you. 

        She looked over and over again at her phone screen, waiting for his sign. Waiting for him to say that he would be coming back to her. To Aunt May. To Ned. But still nothing. Aileen started to question if he was realy coming back. If Karen had a protocol for this type of situation. If she would see him again. She really hoped she would. 


It was late in the afternoon when Aileen realized something was wrong. 

        Ned and her were in Peter’s room building the Lego Death Star for the hundreth time when she looked out of the window and saw something odd. A person had crumbled to dust entirely. She looked further down the street and saw other people suffering from the same fate. She hurriedly got to her phone, desperate to see if Peter was okay. 

Peter: I’m sorry. 

        In that moment, she crumbled too. 

It was morning of the next day when a ragged Tony Stark appeared in Aunt May’s apartament. 

        He looked utterly devasted and lost. Aileen had never seen him like this. Granted, she had never seen him in person before. He couldn't  look Aunt May in the eye. He  had tear stains ain his cheek and, although his clothes were clean, Aileen could tell he hadn’t had a shower yet. He opened his mouth and closed it before asking to come in. 

        Thanos had wiped out half of the universe. Those standing in the room were ‘lucky’ enough to not have become dust. That was what Tony Stark said to them.  Aileen wasn’t sure if she was lucky. She was sure of anything anymore. The only thing she was certain was Peter. And he was gone. 

        Mr. Stark stayed little time. He offered help for May. If she needed anything, he told, she should call him. He looked at Aileen with sad eyes and offered her a smile. That was all he could offer her at the time.

reblog.comment:
Text Messages – a Peter Parker one-shot.

If you enjoy it please reblog and like and pass it on for anyone that’s interested. You guys can comment and send me messages please :)

This is a Peter Parker x OC. CAUTION: INFINITY WAR SPOILERS AHEAD. 

Words: 1024

Aileen was worried sick. 

        Peter had just jumped out of the bus, ready to fight whatever had arrived in the strange round ship. He left, leaving an empty space next to her. He left, with only a squeeze in her hand and a reassuring smile. A smile that said everything would be okay and the he would be back. 

        Aileen wasn’t sure about that anymore. 

        He was gone for hours. And she made sure to stay with Aunt May, so they could emotionally support each other. So she could at least have a sense that Peter, her  Peter, was still there with her. That he did not leave an emptiness inside her when he jumped out of the window not saying anything if he was going to be back or not. Aileen was starting to think that maybe he wouldn’t. And that thought brought tears in her eyes. 

        They had started to date a few months before. Peter took his time to ask her out. After the fiasco with Liz, he didn’t want to jump on another fantasy with some girl that he may not even have a future with. He wanted to make sure he was sure about the girl he went out with. Because he didn’t want to get hurt.         

        When Aileen showed up, it was too good to be true. She was perfect, in Peter’s eyes. She was smart, funny and cute. Aileen was everything he had ever wanted in girl. She was friendly with everyone, even if they were mean to her, and she looked at Peter with the most soft brown eyes he had ever seen. Aileen was going to be Peter’s doom. 

        He asked her out a year later. She said yes. Aileen was waiting for that the entire year she was at Midtown Tech. She loved spending time with Peter. And slowly, she fell in love with him. To her, Peter Parker was the dream boy. He was smart, the smartest person she had ever met, funny, he would make this jokes not intentionally and she would laugh until tears would get out of her eyes, and adorable. How did a guy like him existed?

        Aileen found out Peter was Spider Man a few weeks into their friendship. It only made her fall in love with him more. Except, she didn’t know it would be the doom of her. 

        It was only three hours later that Aileen decided to text Peter. She hoped where he was had cell signal. She hoped he was still alive to answer her. 

Aileen: Are you okay? 

        She sighed, gazing at her phone. She hoped he was alive. She hoped she would get to say all the things she didn’t get to say to him. She really wanted him to come back. 


Aileen had no idea what time it was when he responded. 

        She took her phone and immediately unlocked it. He was alive, and he had answered her text. 

Peter: Um, Karen, answer her that I’m alive. That I will go back to her when this is over. Text her that I love her. 

        Aileen read through the text hundred times. He was alive. And Karen, his A.I., clearly needed to learn how to text. But most, importantly, he loved her. She smiled, a couple of tears running on her cheeks. She texted rapidly to him.

Aileen: I love you too. 

          She quickly got up of Peter’s bed. She needed to tell May that he was alive. 


Aileen wasn’t sure how many times she checked her phone waiting for an answer. 

        She had sent a couple of other texts to him. He had answered all of them. But the last one he hadn’t answered yet. 

Aileen: Is it over yet? I miss you. 

        She looked over and over again at her phone screen, waiting for his sign. Waiting for him to say that he would be coming back to her. To Aunt May. To Ned. But still nothing. Aileen started to question if he was realy coming back. If Karen had a protocol for this type of situation. If she would see him again. She really hoped she would. 


It was late in the afternoon when Aileen realized something was wrong. 

        Ned and her were in Peter’s room building the Lego Death Star for the hundreth time when she looked out of the window and saw something odd. A person had crumbled to dust entirely. She looked further down the street and saw other people suffering from the same fate. She hurriedly got to her phone, desperate to see if Peter was okay. 

Peter: I’m sorry. 

        In that moment, she crumbled too. 

It was morning of the next day when a ragged Tony Stark appeared in Aunt May’s apartament. 

        He looked utterly devasted and lost. Aileen had never seen him like this. Granted, she had never seen him in person before. He couldn't  look Aunt May in the eye. He  had tear stains ain his cheek and, although his clothes were clean, Aileen could tell he hadn’t had a shower yet. He opened his mouth and closed it before asking to come in. 

        Thanos had wiped out half of the universe. Those standing in the room were ‘lucky’ enough to not have become dust. That was what Tony Stark said to them.  Aileen wasn’t sure if she was lucky. She was sure of anything anymore. The only thing she was certain was Peter. And he was gone. 

        Mr. Stark stayed little time. He offered help for May. If she needed anything, he told, she should call him. He looked at Aileen with sad eyes and offered her a smile. That was all he could offer her at the time.

That he did not leave an emptiness inside her when he jumped out of the window not saying anything if he was going to be back or not. Aileen was starting to think that maybe he wouldn’t. And that thought brought tears in her eyes. 

        They had started to date a few months before. Peter took his time to ask her out. After the fiasco with Liz, he didn’t want to jump on another fantasy with some girl that he may not even have a future with. He wanted to make sure he was sure about the girl he went out with. Because he didn’t want to get hurt.         

        When Aileen showed up, it was too good to be true. She was perfect, in Peter’s eyes. She was smart, funny and cute. Aileen was everything he had ever wanted in girl. She was friendly with everyone, even if they were mean to her, and she looked at Peter with the most soft brown eyes he had ever seen. Aileen was going to be Peter’s doom. 

        He asked her out a year later. She said yes. Aileen was waiting for that the entire year she was at Midtown Tech. She loved spending time with Peter. And slowly, she fell in love with him. To her, Peter Parker was the dream boy. He was smart, the smartest person she had ever met, funny, he would make this jokes not intentionally and she would laugh until tears would get out of her eyes, and adorable. How did a guy like him existed?

        Aileen found out Peter was Spider Man a few weeks into their friendship. It only made her fall in love with him more. Except, she didn’t know it would be the doom of her. 

        It was only three hours later that Aileen decided to text Peter. She hoped where he was had cell signal. She hoped he was still alive to answer her. 

Aileen: Are you okay? 

        She sighed, gazing at her phone. She hoped he was alive. She hoped she would get to say all the things she didn’t get to say to him. She really wanted him to come back. 


Aileen had no idea what time it was when he responded. 

        She took her phone and immediately unlocked it. He was alive, and he had answered her text. 

Peter: Um, Karen, answer her that I’m alive. That I will go back to her when this is over. Text her that I love her. 

        Aileen read through the text hundred times. He was alive. And Karen, his A.I., clearly needed to learn how to text. But most, importantly, he loved her. She smiled, a couple of tears running on her cheeks. She texted rapidly to him.

Aileen: I love you too. 

          She quickly got up of Peter’s bed. She needed to tell May that he was alive. 


Aileen wasn’t sure how many times she checked her phone waiting for an answer. 

        She had sent a couple of other texts to him. He had answered all of them. But the last one he hadn’t answered yet. 

Aileen: Is it over yet? I miss you. 

        She looked over and over again at her phone screen, waiting for his sign. Waiting for him to say that he would be coming back to her. To Aunt May. To Ned. But still nothing. Aileen started to question if he was realy coming back. If Karen had a protocol for this type of situation. If she would see him again. She really hoped she would. 


It was late in the afternoon when Aileen realized something was wrong. 

        Ned and her were in Peter’s room building the Lego Death Star for the hundreth time when she looked out of the window and saw something odd. A person had crumbled to dust entirely. She looked further down the street and saw other people suffering from the same fate. She hurriedly got to her phone, desperate to see if Peter was okay. 

Peter: I’m sorry. 

        In that moment, she crumbled too. 

It was morning of the next day when a ragged Tony Stark appeared in Aunt May’s apartament. 

        He looked utterly devasted and lost. Aileen had never seen him like this. Granted, she had never seen him in person before. He couldn't  look Aunt May in the eye. He  had tear stains ain his cheek and, although his clothes were clean, Aileen could tell he hadn’t had a shower yet. He opened his mouth and closed it before asking to come in. 

        Thanos had wiped out half of the universe. Those standing in the room were ‘lucky’ enough to not have become dust. That was what Tony Stark said to them.  Aileen wasn’t sure if she was lucky. She was sure of anything anymore. The only thing she was certain was Peter. And he was gone. 

        Mr. Stark stayed little time. He offered help for May. If she needed anything, he told, she should call him. He looked at Aileen with sad eyes and offered her a smile. That was all he could offer her at the time.

summary: Amazing Spider-Man  #256 (September 1984) The Puma was one of Marvel’s few Native American super-beings. He was not really a...
caption:
Amazing Spider-Man  #256 (September 1984)

The Puma was one of Marvel’s few Native American super-beings. He was not really a superhero, but kind of an anti-hero, if I remember correctly - at least from the hegemonic settler colonialism’s perspective. If I remember correctly, he was some corporate hotshot at the same time as he was his tribe’s Puma-powered defender.  I don’t know for sure, I haven’t read these comics in a long time.

No, what I remember most about this comic is being on a subway platform in the summer of 1984 and hearing some yuppie dude read the call-out boxes on the cover in a mocking voice to his two friends after spotting it on a newsstand. They were all kind of drunk and got a good laugh out of it, but 13-year old me hated them for doing it. I had never heard an adult mock a comic before. In my experience to that point, adults were either indifferent to them or were enthusiastic about them because of their own nostalgia or because they wanted to encourage my reading.  But it also put a seed of doubt in my mind about the value of these things I spent so much energy on, and while I would continue to read and collect comics for another four years, part of me in that moment began to think of them as eventually uncool and forever kiddish.

It didn’t help that I already had the issue when I witnessed the adult drunken mockery and knew it wasn’t very good.

And to be honest, I wasn’t wrong about my suspicions about comics, and there are still some adult readers of superhero comics that engage with them in ways that I see as not very different from my younger self and I feel a little bit of pity for them. On the other hand, I also have learned not to give a fuck what others think about my taste in literature or judge my reasons for liking what I like (or assuming what they are). Is that a contradiction? So be it.

On the other hand, I also have learned not to give a fuck what others think about my taste in literature or judge my reasons for liking what I like (or assuming what they are). Is that a contradiction? So be it.

summary:
Shuri: Do you know what Vines are?
Groot: I am groot? *grows vines*
Peter P: No no, not those vines 
*1 hour later*
Groot: I am...
body:
Shuri: Do you know what Vines are?

Groot: I am groot? *grows vines*

Peter P: No no, not those vines

*1 hour later*

Groot: I am groot!

Rocket: What the fuck do you mean my dick is now a noodle? What does that even … what?

*Peter and Shuri high-fiving in the distance*

summary: hey guys, you know, I’ve been in this fandom for a year now! and I’d like to say, wow, have things changed. i remember when...
body: hey guys, you know, I’ve been in this fandom for a year now! and I’d like to say, wow, have things changed. i remember when spiderman: homecoming first came out! i remember first coming into the fandom! everyone was super nice to each other and there wasn’t any drama! everyone was respectful to each other and we all enjoyed having blurb nights and writing and talking about how talented + hardworking tom was. everything is a lot more cliquey and separated now. especially with all the drama right now, the fandom is split. let’s all try to be more kind, understanding, and respectful and we can make this fandom better. what would tom think if his fans were fighting and cliquey and unwelcoming of each other?
